Hmmm, taking too long to find the paragraph, but the gist of the argument against what he did centers around what he did when it was NOT April Fool's Day.
He continued updating the "arc" for a week beyond it.
And he wrote up explanations citing "hints" that he had planted long in the past like showing in the court room that Lynn had a grey eye like Alaric.
What...they think a well laid out comic prank can be done in a single day? I feel like the pop in only when a stream notification pops up or a new page pops up...nothing more.
they pop in*
It's a trust thing. When someone pranks you on AFD and you get told it's just a prank right then and there, it's whatever, good fun.
But when you continue telling people a week later that, "nope, it's for real, here's evidence that I've been planning this for a long time," you break that trust.
From my time on the internet...there are a lot of assholes who want only what they want on the internet.
I do not know...I still would have taken a grain of salt from it all.
